decks.notes: This deck focuses on using a combination of mill effects, removal spells, and aggressive creatures to disrupt the opponent's strategy while maintaining a steady offensive pressure. The key strategy revolves around using cards like Tinybones, the Pickpocket and Duelist of the Mind to chip away at the opponent's hand size, while cards like Restless Anchorage and Deep-Cavern Bat provide a consistent source of damage. No More Lies and Go for the Throat are used to deal with opposing threats, while Lord Skitter, Sewer King and Faerie Mastermind offer additional creature-based disruption. Overall, the deck aims to control the game and overwhelm the opponent with a mix of aggro and disruption.

This deck focuses on a fast-paced aggressive strategy with a mix of creatures and spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It utilizes evasive creatures like Faerie Mastermind and Deep-Cavern Bat, along with removal spells like Go for the Throat and Cut Down to control the board. The inclusion of powerful legendary creatures like Gix, Yawgmoth Praetor and Ertai Resurrected add additional threats and versatility to the deck. The mana base is streamlined to support the aggressive game plan, with some utility lands like Raffine's Tower for added card advantage.

The main focus of this Boros Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy, utilizing efficient creatures and powerful combat tricks. With a mix of low-cost creatures like Novice Inspector and higher-powered threats like Voldaren Epicure, the deck aims to apply early pressure and maintain the momentum throughout the game. Cards like Resolute Reinforcements and Warleader's Call provide additional ways to go wide and increase the board presence, while key lands like Cavern of Souls and Inspiring Vantage help ensure a smooth mana curve for consistent aggression.

This deck focuses on aggressively attacking the opponent using a combination of creatures with abilities that disrupt the opponent's game plan. It includes cards that allow for removal of opposing threats, as well as creatures that can deal damage quickly. The deck also includes cards that provide evasion to get through blockers and close out the game. With a mix of control elements and aggressive creatures, this Dimir Aggro deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a victory through a combination of strategic plays and efficient card interaction.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on maintaining aggressive board presence and disrupting the opponent's hand with cards like Duress and Cut Down. It also uses removal spells like Go for the Throat to control the board. The key creatures in this deck are Gix, Sheoldred, Tinybones, and Preacher of the Schism, which provide powerful effects and can help maintain pressure on the opponent. The deck includes a mix of creatures with different abilities and mana costs to ensure a variety of threats. Additionally, the deck includes a mix of basic and dual lands to support the deck's mana base.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and direct damage spells. By playing efficient creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Bloodthirsty Adversary, combined with burn spells like Lightning Strike and Obliterating Bolt, the deck aims to reduce the opponent's life total as quickly as possible. Additionally, cards like Kumano Faces Kakkazan and Urabrask's Forge provide additional reach and damage potential. The strategy is to maintain pressure on the opponent from the beginning of the game, forcing them to react and defend against the relentless assault.

This UW Control deck focuses on controlling the board through counterspells, removal, and card advantage. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent by denying their threats and disrupting their game plan. It includes a mix of efficient removal spells like Lightning Helix, along with counterspells like Get Lost and Memory Deluge for card advantage. The deck also has finishers like Jace, the Perfected Mind and The Wandering Emperor to close out the game once it has stabilized. The deck's key strategy is to control the game's tempo and win through incremental advantage.

The deck focuses on aggressive gameplay using a combination of creatures with evasion abilities and removal spells to disrupt opponent's strategy. It also includes lands that provide additional utility and mana fixing. The deck aims to quickly build a board presence and apply pressure on the opponent while maintaining control of the battlefield with removal and disruption spells. The mix of creatures with flying, deathtouch, and other abilities make it difficult for opponents to effectively block or remove threats, giving the deck an edge in combat and tempo.

The deck focuses on using a combination of creature removal, card draw, and powerful control spells to dominate the game. The main strategy involves controlling the board with removal spells and counters, while generating card advantage through card draw. The deck also includes powerful late-game threats like Colossal Skyturtle and Goldvein Hydra to close out the game. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent, with a strong emphasis on control elements and efficient resource management.

The key concept of this deck is to control the board by utilizing cards that limit the opponent's options and protect your own creatures. The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly to play powerful creatures like Topiary Stomper, Archangel of Wrath, and Atraxa, Grand Unifier. Leyline Binding helps to control the opponent's threats, while cards like Depopulate and Glimpse the Core provide additional removal and card draw. With a mix of creature protection, mana ramp, and control elements, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with its powerful creatures and strategic play.

This Bant Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells. The deck utilizes cards like Razorverge Thicket and Seachrome Coast to ramp up quickly and play powerful creatures like Crawling Chorus and Venerated Rotpriest. Fading Hope and Serum Snare help control the opponent's board while March of Swirling Mist and Three Steps Ahead allow for explosive turns. The deck aims to apply pressure early and consistently to secure a swift victory.

The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy. By utilizing low-cost creatures like Novice Inspector and Voldaren Epicure, along with powerful spells like Gleeful Demolition and Resolute Reinforcements, the deck aims to apply constant pressure and quickly finish off the opponent. The deck also includes utility lands like Eiganjo, Seat of the Empire and Sokenzan, Crucible of Defiance to provide additional support for its aggressive game plan. Overall, the deck focuses on speed and efficiency to dominate the battlefield.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly building a board presence and overwhelming the opponent with a combination of creatures and spells. The deck includes efficient creatures like Knight-Errant of Eos and Voldaren Epicure, alongside cards like Resolute Reinforcements and Warleader's Call to quickly pump out tokens and put pressure on the opponent. With a mix of aggressive creatures and combat tricks, this deck aims to close out games quickly by attacking relentlessly and not allowing the opponent to stabilize.
